findings.title: Arithmetic vulnerability
findings.explanation: Unchecked addition and multiplication on jackpotSize, devFeeSize, lockedInBets and totalAmountToWhale allow potential integer overflow/underflow (no SafeMath used)

findings.title: Unchecked Low Level Calls vulnerability
findings.explanation: Low-level call to whale.call.value(...) result is not checked, leading to possible silent failure

findings.title: Denial Of Service vulnerability
findings.explanation: Using .transfer for ETH payouts in payout() and sendRefund() can revert if the recipient is a malicious or broken contract, causing play or refund calls to fail and lock the contract in an unusable state.

findings.title: Bad Randomness vulnerability
findings.explanation: Randomness is derived from blockhash(blockNumber) and user reveal, which is predictable and manipulable by miners

findings.title: Front Running vulnerability
findings.explanation: The secretSigner’s signature only covers ticketID and expiration but not msg.sender, allowing an attacker to watch a pending wager tx in the mempool and submit the same signature first to claim the ticket before the legitimate user.

findings.title: Other vulnerability
findings.explanation: Unsafe low-level external call using `whale.call.value(donate_amount)(...)` without checking the return value, leading to potential reentrancy or silent failure

vulnerability_location.description: Unchecked addition and multiplication on jackpotSize, devFeeSize, lockedInBets and totalAmountToWhale allow potential integer overflow/underflow (no SafeMath used)
Low-level call to whale.call.value(...) result is not checked, leading to possible silent failure

Using .transfer for ETH payouts in payout() and sendRefund() can revert if the recipient is a malicious or broken contract, causing play or refund calls to fail and lock the contract in an unusable state.
Randomness is derived from blockhash(blockNumber) and user reveal, which is predictable and manipulable by miners

The secretSigner’s signature only covers ticketID and expiration but not msg.sender, allowing an attacker to watch a pending wager tx in the mempool and submit the same signature first to claim the ticket before the legitimate user.
Unsafe low-level external call using `whale.call.value(donate_amount)(...)` without checking the return value, leading to potential reentrancy or silent failure
